prs.title: 🚀 Version packages
prs.truncated_body:
This PR was opened by the [Changesets release](https://github.com/changesets/action) GitHub action. When you're ready to do a release, you can merge this and the packages will be published to npm automatically. If you're not ready to do a release yet, that's fine, whenever you add more changesets to main, this PR will be updated.


# Releases
## @layerzerolabs/devtools-move@1.0.7

### Patch Change

prs.title: 🚀 feat(oft-solana): remove need for manual solana endpoint ID input
prs.truncated_body:
# Motivation

For the Solana OFT to have higher DevEx parity with EVM OFTs, there should not be a need to manually specify the Solana eid.


# DevEx Impact,

Currently, there are two tasks that require manual passing of the `--solana-eid` param:

```bash
npx hardhat lz:oft:solana:init-config --oapp-config layerzero.config.ts --solana-eid 40168
```

```bash
npx hardhat lz:oapp:wire --

commits.message: remove need for manual solana endpoint ID input

prs.title: Move CLI Devex Improvements
prs.truncated_body: https://linear.app/layerzerolabs/issue/INT-180/move-vm-cli-devex-improvements

commits.message: 📜 Update README and configuration for Aptos and Initia examples; remove shared_decimals from OFT initialization parameters for consistency
📜 Update README files for Initia examples; add instructions for converting bech32 addresses to hex format and adjust localDecimals in OFT metadata
📜 Update README and .env.example files for Aptos and Movement configurations; simplify instructions and remove hardcoded URLs for better clarity and flexibility. Also adding initiad version check
Add new changelog for Devex improvements and patch updates for multiple LayerZero Labs packages.

prs.title: 🚀 feat(oft-solana): support loading keypair via path
prs.truncated_body:
# Motivation

The default Solana devex when it comes to keypairs is to use the keypair at the default path of `~/.config/solana/id.json`. We should support this.

# Change to DevEx

The edit to the README.md sums it up nicely:

> By default, the scripts will use the keypair at the default location `~/.config/solana/id.json`. If you want to use this keypair, there is no need to set any envi

commits.message: undefined if no default keypair file

prs.title: feat: Adds MemoryContractMetadata implementation
prs.truncated_body:
This PR introduces core interfaces and an in-memory implementation of `ContractMetadataStore`.

The `ContractMetadata` type is generic over the `Metadata` field, which can be any user defined type, as long as it implements the Cloneable interface. This provides flexibility in how metadata is represented while ensuring safe cloning behavior.

A default metadata type implementation, `DefaultMeta

prs.title: store: Check that we map all the tables that MirrorJob needs

commits.message: store: Check that we map all the tables that MirrorJob needs
store: Address corner case in VidBatcher
store: Never set start of VidBatcher beyond max_vid+1
store: Do not mark database unavailable for failed try_get_fdw

store: Be more careful about exiting copy_data_internal early

We need to be absolutely sure that when `copy_data_internal` is done, we
have a connection in `self.conn` and therefore want to make it clear when
we might exit early with an error

store: Spawn copy workers on the blocking pool

Otherwise, they don't really run in parallel
store: Make sure we release the copy lock even if a worker panics
store: Better error when a copy batch times out
store: Reset the end of VidBatcher when changing the size

graph: Reduce default fdw_fetch_size to 1000

10,000 seems too big and actually slows things down
store: If copying encounters an error, wait for all workers to finish
store: Clarify the logic of the control loop in copy_data_internal

store: Take ownership of self in CopyConnection.copy_data

This ensures that `copy_data` can't be called more than once on any
instance; when copying encounters an error, it might leave the
CopyConnection in an inconsistent state and should therefore not be reused

Also make `copy_data_internal` private; it should never be called from the
outside

prs.title: op-deployer: Add intent builder
prs.truncated_body: Based on conversations with @protolambda, we need an easier way of defining chain deployments for use within tests. This PR does that by introducing a new "builder" API for op-deployer intents. This API allows users to define chain intents using a more functional style and with fewer required fields. In the future, this will allow chain intents/state to be automatically hydrated from existing on-c

commits.message:
op-deployer: Add intent builder

Based on conversations with @protolambda, we need an easier way of defining chain deployments for use within tests. This PR does that by introducing a new "builder" API for op-deployer intents. This API allows users to define chain intents using a more functional style and with fewer required fields. In the future, this will allow chain intents/state to be automatically hydrated from existing on-chain data to allow for incremental deployments.

For the time being, the builder exists in a dedicated subpackage of op-deployer. we can change this later. I also added support for customizing the start timestamp/block hash of L2s rather than relying on `time.Now()` or the `latest` block. This will make test more deterministic.

prs.truncated_body:

Adds new steps in the op-acceptance-test workflow which show:
* summary of results
* logs of failed tests
* logs of all tests

Also, all the log artifacts should now be stored in CircleCI for future reference.

The summary of results looks like so:

```
TEST SUMMARY
============
Run ID: 795e1b86-ead5-4f29-92e5-cfdff4036b4e
Time: 2025-04-03T10:16:27+11:00
Duration:

prs.title: chore(solver/api): standardise structured errors

 - Add `errors.Format(err)` via `%+v` verb to our structured errors library
 - Extend `lib/token.Token` with `AmtToF64`, `F64ToAmt` and `FormatAmt` functions for improved working with token amount with different units.

prs.title: chore(lib/ethclient): close idle connections periodically
prs.truncated_body:
Add `CloseIdleConnectionsForever` to ethclient. Call it in production use-cases.

This aims to mitigate the problem of TCP-keep-alive maintaining long-lived connections to stalled (but alive) RCP servers. This sometimes occurs with QuickNode, when one of the load-balanced upstream servers/nodes stalled, but we remain connected to it, requiring a restart of the affected service to reconnect to a

Removes `flowgen` solverNetThresholds since it only does ETH, not any tokens, so it doesn't have balance and alerts not required.

prs.title: quic: fix ping_sent flag
prs.truncated_body: There are currently 2 ping-related connection flags. One is CONN_FLAGS_PING and the other is CONN_FLAGS_PING_SENT. Ping_sent is intended to prevent sending new pings when there is already a ping in-flight. We should only ever unset it on reclaiming or retrying a pkt_meta. However, there is one extra unset right now during keep-alive (which, to be fair, is not in use rn). This PR fixes that.

prs.title: NPM Publish: Explicitly build before release
prs.truncated_body:
Previous yarn versions honored all pre/post npm scripts, but yarn v4 doesn't so the "prerelease" script which built the packages didn't run on the last release. Running `yarn build:all` explicitly will create all the "dist" directories for each package and running `yarn pack` in each package will generate the NPM package that includes the `dist`, so it is the github action that is the issue.

Ex

commits.message:
Build before release

Previously, when using NX this script had a cached build to work with and didn't need to build all packages before

Removed all pre/post scripts to work with yarn v4

Except for a few explicitly defined scripts yarn v4 doesn't support these natively

prs.title: [1/2] chore(pectra): cleanup misc ssz and version stuff
prs.truncated_body: Primary intention is/was to remove the [eip7685](https://github.com/berachain/beacon-kit/blob/main/primitives/eip7685/ssz.go) package for (un)marshaling the electra lists. UPDATE: determined it is not possible. EL requests are not marshalled in the standard SSZ formatting for list types, instead it is just concatenated bytes for each of the individual marshalled objects (which happen to use SSZ).

prs.title: feat(fork): timestamp based forking (1/n)
prs.truncated_body:
This PR introduces timestamp based forking, transitioning from epoch based forking. The goal of this PR is to only modify the way in which fork versions are set. It attempts to not touch the way fork version are used or accessed.

- [x] Change `ActiveForkVersionForSlot` and `ActiveForkVersionForEpoch` to `ActiveForkVersionForTimestamp`
- [x] Change `<forkVersion>Epoch` chainspec values to `<for

prs.title: feat(pectra): Add `engine_getPayloadV4`
prs.truncated_body: We MUST call `engine_getPayloadV4` when we are on the pectra fork according to [engine API spec updates](https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/prague.md#update-the-methods-of-previous-forks), even if our implementation is able to discriminate engine api responses under the hood for different forks. For some reason, geth and reth do not enforce that you use `getPayloadV4`

prs.title: feat: Improve important service call instrumentation
prs.truncated_body:
# About
This PR adds extra instrumentation decorators to important service calls to allow better tracking of failures, we currently fall back to the API style stringification of errors, as an improvement one might one to create separate tracing stringifications for Errors that have even more information.

# Testing
tested manually via observing the new otel traces.

The Keeper should only be concerned with storing the current set of open requests (`Keeper

$ stellar-strkey zero public_key_ed25519
GAAAAAAAAAAAAAA

prs.title: chore: add make fix-rocksdb command
prs.truncated_body:
### Motivation

Sometimes when rocksdb is upgraded, the `python-rocksdb` bindings installation stops working, and a simple reinstall with `--no-binary` fixes it. This PR adds this command to the Makefile so it's easier for new devs to deal with this.

PS: Poetry does support [the no-binary option](https://python-poetry.org/docs/configuration/#installerno-binary) as a local config, but I couldn

prs.title: fix: Call `endRound` after dispatch
prs.truncated_body:
Fixes https://github.com/hiero-ledger/hiero-consensus-node/issues/18622


- Always calls `blockRecordManager.endRound(state)`, when system transactions are dispatched, so the running hashes are updated
- Calls `recordCache.commitRoundReceipts` after all dispatches
- Changes `hapiTestCrypto` to run with 3 nodes for stabilizing with resource allocation issues

prs.title: feat: add signature recovery id calculation
prs.truncated_body:
## Description:
This PR introduces a new method, `getRecoveryId(r, s, message)`, to the `PrivateKey` class. It enables calculation of the  recovery ID from a ECDSA signature (v) directly from the raw r and s signature components and the original message.

## Motivation:
Currently, there is no way to calculate the recovery ID (v) when signing Ethereum transactions using the JS SDK. The recovery

commits.message:
